greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q^(-1/4) * eta(q^2) * eta(q^5)^3 / (eta(q) * eta(q^10)) in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: a(n) = b(4*n + 1) where b(n) is multiplicative and b(2^e) = 0^e, b(5^e) = 1, b(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 4), b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e)/2 if p == 3 (mod 4).
Expansion of f(x, x^4) * f(x^2, x^3) in powers of x where f() is the Ramanujan two-variable theta function.
Expansion of psi(x)^2 - x * psi(x^5)^2 in powers of x where psi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (40 t)) = 2 (t/i) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A133573.
Convolution product of A133100 and A133101. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 10 2015
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x^2] QPochhammer[ x^5]^3 / (QPochhammer[ x] QPochhammer[ x^10]), {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Feb 10 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^5 + A)^3 / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^10 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Aug 24 2006
